text.section: In this section, "small denomination bonds" means bonds in denominations of $5,000 or less.

In accordance with § 8-121 of this subtitle, the Board, in a resolution setting forth the terms and conditions of any State bond issue, may designate that all or a portion of the State bonds be issued as small denomination bonds.
Small denomination bonds may be issued in any form permitted under § 8-121 of this subtitle.

The Board may sell small denomination bonds at a negotiated sale if the Board determines that a negotiated sale will:
result in either a more efficient or economical sale of the bonds; or
provide greater access to investors who are residents of the State of Maryland.
